name: Interviewer
line: Q Tell me about the weekend. What did you think?

name: Interviewer
line: A It was great. I was happy to see so many people here and so much interest and attention.

name: Interviewer
line: Q It must be good to be back in Waterloo ...

name: Interviewer
line: Q You've achieved a great deal of fame very quickly. The Financial Post late last June called you the "cryptocurrency prophet." What is it like to be sought after for selfies and celebrated as a celebrity at age 23?

name: Interviewer
line: A It's unusual. Sometimes I don't know how to feel. It's just ... weird. I'd rather not be a prophet.

name: Interviewer
line: Q The technology giants Facebook, Google, Amazon and the like have generated a great deal of criticism lately for a variety of behaviours. Is the decentralized nature of Ethereum the cure for what ails technology?

name: Interviewer
line: A It definitely is one thing that people are excited about the whole idea of decentralized applications is that you can have applications that lots of people use without one guy being fully in charge. That is definitely an idea that can be ... interesting, and one of the big reasons we're excited.

name: Interviewer
line: Q The people attending ETHWaterloo all understand the potential of Ethereum and blockchain technology. The average person on the street however would, at best, likely have only a vague idea of the concepts and probably no understanding of its value or how it is likely to affect their life. How do you bridge that gap?

name: Interviewer
line: A I think the main barriers right now are technical ones. So, basically, the scalability is not that good yet. Privacy is not that good yet. It's going to take a while for all the tools to get built. Safety is going to improve, user experience is going to improve and it will just take a few years for all that to get there.

name: Interviewer
line: Q What role can Waterloo Region play in its development?

name: Interviewer
line: A I think there's a very strong math and science community here. They're exactly the right kind of people to build great blockchain applications and possibly become developers and researchers.

name: Interviewer
line: Q What is the value of a hackathon like this one?

name: Interviewer
line: A Hackathons are a great way to bring people together, bring ideas together, and very often get interesting projects started. I think those things are all very valuable. I liked this hackathon in particular because it felt like it was a hackathon and a conference at the same time, and you had some of both, and I thought that was very interesting.
